sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"使有条理，安排"之意。
means: organize ： 指按计划或需要把人或物安排组织成一个整体。
arrange ： 指按计划、秩序、需要和可能等进行安排。
classify ： 指按照事物类型、质量或是否相似进行分类。
sort ： 通常指根据类型或种类分类或整理选择。

word_mean: 组织，构成：形成有组织的结构

sentence.Network_en: In the end, we all decided to organize a concert for Easter.
sentence.Network_cn: 最终，我们一致决定组织一场复活节音乐会。

sentence.Network_en: It's the first time farmers have decided to organize.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是农场主首次决定组织起来。

sentence.Network_en: He never understood how to organize or compress large masses of material.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从来就不懂如何对大篇的材料进行整理或精简。

the program supports projects to further organize your files ., 该计划支持项目 , 以进一步整理档案.
组字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 组件〖 assembly〗 组建〖 organize〗 组哨〖 groupsentry〗.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from medieval Latin organizare, from Latin organum 'instrument, tool' (see organ)

entry.def: If you organize an event or activity, you make sure that the necessary arrangements are made.

example.ex: In the end, we all decided to organize a concert for Easter.
example.tran: 最终，我们一致决定组织一场复活节音乐会。

example.ex: ...a two-day meeting organised by the United Nations...
example.tran: 由联合国组织的为期两天的会议

entry.tran: 提供，准备（想要或所需之物）
entry.def: If you organize something that someone wants or needs, you make sure that it is provided.

example.ex: He rang his wife and asked her to organize coffee and sandwiches.
example.tran: 他给妻子打电话，叫她准备好咖啡和三明治。

entry.tran: 整理；使有条理；使具结构
entry.def: If you organize a set of things, you arrange them in an ordered way or give them a structure.

example.ex: He began to organize his materials...
She took a hasty cup of coffee and tried to organize her scattered thoughts.
example.tran: 她匆匆喝了杯咖啡，试图整理一下纷乱的思绪。

entry.def: If you organize yourself, you plan your work and activities in an ordered, efficient way.

example.ex: Go right ahead, I'm sure you don't need me to organize you...
example.tran: 只管干吧，我相信你用不着我来为你安排。

entry.def: If someone organizes workers or if workers organize, they form a group or society such as a trade union in order to have more power.

example.tran: 帮助组织在国外工作的妇女

example.ex: It's the first time farmers have decided to organize.
example.tran: 这是农场主首次决定组织起来。

means.word_mean: 2. cause to be structured or ordered or operating according to some principle or idea

sentences.sentence: "Can you help me organize my files?"

means.word_mean: 5. arrange by systematic planning and united effort;

sentences.sentence: "devise a plan to take over the director's office"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Maintenance mechanics among them have helped organize the space.

auth_sentence.content: We must organize a little dinner to celebrate the event.
auth_sentence.res_content: We must organize a little dinner to celebrate the event.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We must organize a little dinner to celebrate the event.

auth_sentence.res_content: Each town must organize charity for the support of the honest poor.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Each town must organize charity for the support of the honest poor.

stems_affixes.word_buile: in无+organic[adj.器官的, 有机的, 组织的]→adj.无生物的, 无机的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 器官的, 有机的, 组织的
stems_affixes.word_buile: organ[ n.器官;风琴;机构]+ic……的→adj.器官的, 有机的, 组织的
organ器官,工具→ n.器官;风琴;机构
organ器官,工具+ism性质→n.生物体, 有机体
organize[v.组织, 使有机化, 给予生机 v.组织起来]→ v.组织

stems_affixes.value_cn: 组织, 使有机化, 给予生机
stems_affixes.word_buile: organ器官;机构+ize……化→v.组织, 使有机化, 给予生机 v.组织起来

Sentence.sentence: Donna helped the people of the village to organize an irrigation project, and she also advised them on planting corps that didn't require much water.
The recent sculpture exhibit was not well organized.

sentences.en: He has the ability to organize.
When it was dark, they organized an attack a third time.
sentences.cn: 天黑的时候, 他们组织了第三次进攻。

jushi.chinese: 不要浪费时间哀悼了。组织起来!

jushi.english: He has the ability to organize.
I'm trying to organize these drawers.
